skillTree.localised_description: To fire the forges and bring true craft and artifice back into the world.
All Dwarfs are stubborn, but none more so than Grudgebearer, the founder of the Age of Reckoning.
This stubborn Dwarf refuses to yield or tire, and ensures his followers are of the same ilk.
The endless courage of the Warrior God, directed to bolster this Dawi’s own reserves.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +20% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +35% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +50% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Morgrim is the Ancestor God of Engineers, developing the first bolt and stone throwers of the Dwarves.

effects.description:
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
	(local province)

Upkeep: -10% for Artillery, Gyrocopters, and Gyrobombers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Best metals provided only by dwarf guilds.
With so little rattle and recoil, a firearm can be kept stable enough to fire with greater accuracy from much further away.
Engineering ingenuity extended to mining and excavation implements can also prove useful to a battlefield skirmisher.

ui_effects.localised_text: Bombards the area around the caster
Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Through the skin to kill the soul.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
All Dwarfs despise the Greenskins, for the urki and grobi are the prime agents in the Times of Woe.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +7% when fighting against Greenskins
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins

skillTree.localised_description: Arrows, cannonballs and more esoteric munitions are needed in endless supply on the battlefield.
Silent, swift and very, very deadly, this one can take down the foe from range without breaking a sweat or revealing his position.
Only the foolish go on the hunt without supplies and a cast-iron plan.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
Dwarfen craftsmanship ensures any weapon is infinitely more likely to run out of ammunition before succumbing to the stress of battle!
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Lord and his az are never separated, for it is as much part of him as his beard.

skillTree.localised_description: Dwarfs are long-lived with many years of battlefield experience, making them excellent tacticians.

skillTree.localised_description: Full of grim determination, when Dwarfs join battle there is no retreat, only victory or death.

skillTree.localised_description: None know the strength of the Dawi better than those who've suffered their firepower firsthand.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Dwarf spent time in the pits, gaining a Miner's intuition of the dangers and prey to be found in the dark.

Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +16%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: "I have seen better lavatory walls than this - I'll have it down by the morrow, that's a pledge!"

skillTree.localised_description: A Dwarf with a fine beard is as Dawi as they come.
Lords close to the powerful Masons' Guild will get discounts for labour and materials.

skillTree.localised_description: Such a Dawi does not care for being wounded - by his will alone he continues to fight.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "All Dwarfs to me! We have grudges to settle - Grimnir demands it!"
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: A wise Lord will gather Engineers to his service, ensuring the Dwarfs maintain their technological edge.

Explosion does not affect friendly troops

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This brave Dawi can trace his lineage back to Grimnir, the Warrior-God.
This industrious Dawi can trace his lineage back to Grungni, God of Mines and Smiths.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This loyal Dawi can trace his lineage back to Valaya, Goddess of Healing and Protection.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Even in the time of the Ancestor Gods, Gazul pondered long on the mortality of his race.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Morgrim was the first Dwarf Engineer. He developed and taught his clans the techniques of crafting engines of war and other devices.
Smednir is a Dwarf deity of some importance, because of his patronage of metalworking and the refining of ore.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -10% for all units
	(own armies in province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The younger son of Grungni and Valaya, Thungni is the god of Runic magic and runesmithing.

effects.description:
Magic item drop chance: +25%
	(own characters in region)

Upkeep: -10% for Lords and Heroes
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Greenskins don't deserve to live longer than a fly.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Greenskins
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Skaven will die for our brothers lost in the deep tunnels!

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Skaven
